alert.note: Alert for Eastern Gifford Pinchot NF - Mt Adams Ranger District; Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 19 at 2:56PM PDT until August 20 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...DRY AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS THIS WEEKEND... ...POOR OVERNIGHT HUMIDITY RECOVERIES IN THE CASCADES SATURDAY NIGHT WITH INCREASING EASTERLY WINDS... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT SUNDAY FOR SIGNIFICANTLY UNSTABLE CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 607, 608, 660, AND 663... * AFFECTED AREA...In Oregon, Fire Weather Zone 607 Mt. Hood National Forest West of Cascade Crest and Fire Weather Zone 608 Willamette National Forest. In Washington, Fire Weather Zone 660 Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills and Fire Weather Zone 663 Eastern Gifford Pinchot National Forest Mt Adams Ranger District. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 18 percent. * WIND...Easterly winds increasing to 5-15 mph late Saturday evening into Saturday night, continuing through at least Sunday morning. Main wind concerns are for mid and upper slopes. * TEMPERATURES...Mainly in the 70s. * HAINES...From 4 (moderate) to 6 (high). * IMPACTS...Conditions may be favorable for rapid spread on any new or existing fires. Extreme fire behavior is possible. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of the above conditions can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Gifford Pinchot NF - Mt Adams Ranger District; Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills
